newsitem.title: USA: Cardiovascular Diagnostics, Lilly in pact.
newsitem.headline: Cardiovascular Diagnostics, Lilly in pact.

text.p: Cardiovascular Diagnostics Inc said Friday that it signed a development agreement with Eli Lilly and Co for treatment of sepsis.

Under the agreement, Cardiovascular will use its dry chemistry technology to develop a rapid point of care test to monitor a therapeutic anticoagulant presently under development at Lilly for use in the treatment of sepsis.
The comapny said that Lilly will provide funding based on milestone payments that coincide with the successful completion of Cardiovascualr's five phases of design review for development projects.
Cardiovascualr said that its goal is to complete clinical trials and submit a 510K application to the FDA by the end of January, 1998.
Sepsis is caused by pathogens circulating in the blood that can result in serious complications such as organ failure.
With a 30-50 percent mortality rate, sepsis is the 13th most frequent cause death in the United States, Cardiovascual said.
